# Complete UI Guide

Comprehensive guide to all pages and features in the Modular Trade Agent web interface.

## üè† Dashboard Overview

After logging in, you'll see the main dashboard with navigation to all features.

## üìÑ Page-by-Page Guide

### 1. Buying Zone (`/dashboard/buying-zone`)

**Purpose:** View and manage trading signals generated by the system.

#### Features

**Signal Display:**
- Table view of all signals
- Customizable columns (40+ available)
- Default columns: Symbol, Status, Distance to EMA9, Backtest Score, Confidence, ML Confidence
- Sortable columns
- Real-time updates

**Filters:**
- **Date Filter:** Filter signals by date (today, yesterday, custom range)
- **Status Filter:** 
  - `active` - Active signals
  - `rejected` - Rejected signals
  - `null` - All signals

**Column Customization:**
- Click column selector icon
- Choose from 40+ available columns
- Minimum 5 columns, maximum 20 columns
- Saved preferences persist

**Available Columns:**
- **Basic:** Symbol, Status, Timestamp
- **Technical Indicators:** RSI10, EMA9, EMA200, Distance to EMA9
- **Scoring:** Backtest Score, Combined Score, Strength Score, Priority Score
- **ML:** ML Verdict, ML Confidence
- **Trading Parameters:** Buy Range, Target, Stop, Last Close
- **Fundamentals:** PE, PB, Fundamental OK
- **Volume:** Avg Vol, Today Vol, Volume Ratio, Vol OK
- **Analysis:** Verdict, Final Verdict, Rule Verdict, Verdict Source
- **Dip Features:** Dip Depth %, Dip Speed %/Day, Decline Slowing, Vol G/R Ratio

**Actions:**
- **Reject Signal:** Click reject button to mark signal as rejected
- **View Details:** Click on signal row to view detailed information
- **Export:** Export signals to CSV (if implemented)

#### Usage Tips
- Use date filter to review historical signals
- Customize columns to show most relevant data
- Reject signals that don't meet your criteria
- Monitor ML confidence for ML-enhanced signals

---

### 2. Orders (`/dashboard/orders`)

**Purpose:** Monitor order execution and status.

#### Features

**Order Display:**
- Table view of all orders
- Real-time status updates
- Auto-refresh enabled

**Filters:**
- **Status Filter:**
  - `open` - Pending orders
  - `filled` - Executed orders
  - `cancelled` - Cancelled orders
  - `rejected` - Rejected orders
  - `all` - All orders

**Order Information:**
- Symbol
- Quantity
- Price
- Order Type (MARKET, LIMIT)
- Transaction Type (BUY, SELL)
- Status
- Timestamps (created, updated)
- Exchange, Product, Variety
- Order IDs (system and broker)

**Actions:**
- **Refresh:** Manual refresh button
- **View Details:** Click order to view full details
- **Cancel Order:** Cancel pending orders (if supported)

#### Usage Tips
- Monitor order status regularly
- Check rejected orders for issues
- Review filled orders for execution quality
- Use filters to focus on specific order types

---

### 3. Targets (`/dashboard/targets`)

**Purpose:** Manage target prices and stop losses for positions.

#### Features

**Target Display:**
- List of all active targets
- Real-time price updates
- P&L calculation

**Target Information:**
- Symbol
- Entry Price
- Target Price (EMA9)
- Stop Loss
- Current Price
- Current P&L (absolute and percentage)
- Distance to Target
- Distance to Stop

**Actions:**
- **View Details:** Click target to view full details
- **Monitor Progress:** Track progress toward target

#### Usage Tips
- Monitor targets regularly
- Review P&L to assess performance
- Check distance to target/stop for risk assessment

---

### 4. P&L (`/dashboard/pnl`)

**Purpose:** Track trading performance and profitability.

#### Features

**P&L Summary:**
- Overall P&L
- Realized P&L
- Unrealized P&L
- Total Trades
- Win Rate
- Average Return

**P&L by Position:**
- Individual position P&L
- Entry vs Current Price
- Percentage Gains/Losses

**Historical P&L:**
- Date range filtering
- Performance trends
- Monthly/yearly summaries

**Actions:**
- **Filter by Date:** Select date range
- **Export:** Export P&L data (if implemented)

#### Usage Tips
- Review P&L regularly
- Analyze win rate
- Identify best/worst performing positions
- Use historical data for strategy improvement

---

### 5. Paper Trading (`/dashboard/paper-trading`)

**Purpose:** Test trading strategies without real money.

#### Features

**Portfolio View:**
- Current holdings
- Average price
- Current value
- Unrealized P&L

**Trade Execution:**
- Manual trade execution
- Buy/Sell orders
- Quantity and price input
- Realistic execution simulation

**Trade History:**
- All paper trades
- Execution details
- Fees and charges
- P&L per trade

**Settings:**
- Initial capital configuration
- Enable/disable paper trading

#### Usage Tips
- Start with paper trading before going live
- Test different strategies
- Monitor performance
- Learn without risk

---

### 6. Trading Configuration (`/dashboard/config`)

**Purpose:** Configure all trading strategy parameters.

#### Configuration Sections

**1. Strategy Configuration:**
- RSI Period (default: 10)
- RSI Oversold Threshold (default: 30)
- RSI Extreme Oversold (default: 10)
- RSI Near Oversold (default: 35)

**2. Capital & Position Management:**
- User Capital (default: ‚Çπ2,00,000)
- Paper Trading Initial Capital (default: ‚Çπ10,00,000)
- Max Portfolio Size
- Max Position Volume Ratio (default: 10%)
- Min Absolute Average Volume

**3. Chart Quality Filters:**
- Chart Quality Enabled
- Chart Quality Min Score
- Max Gap Frequency
- Min Daily Range %
- Max Extreme Candle Frequency

**4. Risk Management:**
- Default Stop Loss %
- Tight Stop Loss %
- Min Stop Loss %
- Default Target %
- Strong Buy Target %
- Excellent Target %
- Risk-Reward Ratios

**5. Order Defaults:**
- Default Exchange (NSE)
- Default Product (MIS, CNC, NRML)
- Default Order Type (MARKET, LIMIT)
- Default Variety (REGULAR, AMO)
- Default Validity (DAY, IOC)

**6. Behavior Toggles:**
- Allow Duplicate Recommendations Same Day
- Exit on EMA9 or RSI50
- Min Combined Score
- Enable Premarket AMO Adjustment

**7. News Sentiment:**
- News Sentiment Enabled
- Lookback Days (default: 30)
- Min Articles
- Positive/Negative Thresholds

**8. ML Configuration:**
- ML Enabled
- ML Model Version
- ML Confidence Threshold
- ML Combine with Rules

#### Presets
- **Conservative:** Lower risk settings
- **Moderate:** Balanced settings
- **Aggressive:** Higher risk settings
- **Custom:** Your custom settings

#### Actions
- **Save:** Save configuration changes
- **Reset:** Reset to default values
- **Load Preset:** Apply preset configuration

#### Usage Tips
- Start with default or moderate preset
- Adjust parameters based on performance
- Test changes with paper trading first
- Document your custom settings

---

### 7. Service Status (`/dashboard/service`)

**Purpose:** Monitor and control automated trading services.

#### Features

**Service Controls:**
- Start/Stop service button
- Service status indicator
- Last heartbeat time
- Service uptime

**Task History:**
- Recent task executions
- Task status (success, failed, running)
- Execution times
- Task details

**Individual Services:**
- Run individual tasks
- View individual service status
- Conflict detection
- Schedule information

**Service Logs:**
- Recent service logs
- Log level filtering
- Real-time updates
- Error tracking

**Auto-Refresh:**
- Toggle auto-refresh
- Configurable refresh intervals
- Real-time updates when enabled

#### Actions
- **Start Service:** Start automated trading service
- **Stop Service:** Stop automated trading service
- **Run Task:** Execute individual task
- **View Logs:** View service logs
- **Toggle Auto-Refresh:** Enable/disable auto-refresh

#### Usage Tips
- Keep service running for automated trading
- Monitor logs for errors
- Review task execution history
- Use individual services for testing

---

### 8. Service Schedule (`/dashboard/admin/schedules`) - Admin Only

**Purpose:** Configure service schedules and execution times.

#### Features

**Schedule Management:**
- View all scheduled tasks
- Enable/disable tasks
- Set execution times
- Configure task schedules

**Task Configuration:**
- Task parameters
- Dependencies
- Schedule status

#### Actions
- **Enable/Disable Task:** Toggle task execution
- **Set Schedule:** Configure execution time
- **Save Changes:** Apply schedule changes

---

### 9. Settings (`/dashboard/settings`)

**Purpose:** Configure system settings.

#### Features

**Broker Credentials:**
- Consumer Key
- Consumer Secret
- Access Token
- User ID
- **Security:** Credentials encrypted before storage

**Telegram Settings:**
- Bot Token
- Chat ID
- Enable/Disable Notifications

#### Actions
- **Save Credentials:** Save and encrypt credentials
- **Test Connection:** Test broker connection (if implemented)
- **Enable/Disable Telegram:** Toggle Telegram notifications

#### Usage Tips
- Keep credentials secure
- Test broker connection after updating
- Enable Telegram for important notifications

---

### 10. Log Viewer (`/dashboard/logs`)

**Purpose:** View and manage system logs.

#### Features

**Log Display:**
- Table view of logs
- Real-time updates
- Pagination

**Filters:**
- **Log Level:** DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR
- **Date Range:** Filter by date
- **Search:** Text search in logs

**User/Admin Scopes:**
- **User:** View own logs
- **Admin:** View all user logs

**Error Tracking:**
- Error logs highlighted
- Error statistics
- Error resolution workflow

#### Actions
- **Filter Logs:** Apply filters
- **Search:** Search log content
- **Export:** Export logs (if implemented)
- **Clear Filters:** Reset filters

#### Usage Tips
- Monitor ERROR logs regularly
- Use filters to focus on specific issues
- Search for specific error messages
- Review logs for troubleshooting

---

### 11. ML Training (`/dashboard/admin/ml`) - Admin Only

**Purpose:** Manage ML model training and retraining.

#### Features

**Training Management:**
- Start/Stop training jobs
- View training status
- Training progress indicator
- Training history

**Model Management:**
- View available models
- Select model version
- View model performance
- Model comparison

**Training Configuration:**
- Model version selection
- Force retrain option
- Training parameters

#### Actions
- **Start Training:** Start new training job
- **Stop Training:** Stop running training
- **View Models:** View available models
- **Select Model:** Choose model version

#### Usage Tips
- Train models regularly with new data
- Monitor training progress
- Compare model performance
- Use best performing model

---

### 12. User Management (`/dashboard/admin/users`) - Admin Only

**Purpose:** Manage users and roles.

#### Features

**User List:**
- View all users
- User details (email, name, role)
- User status (active/inactive)
- Creation date

**User Management:**
- Create new users
- Activate/deactivate users
- Change user roles
- Delete users (if supported)

#### Actions
- **Create User:** Add new user
- **Edit User:** Modify user details
- **Activate/Deactivate:** Toggle user status
- **Change Role:** Update user role

#### Usage Tips
- Regularly review user list
- Deactivate unused accounts
- Assign appropriate roles
- Keep admin access limited

---

### 13. Activity (`/dashboard/activity`)

**Purpose:** Track user activity and system events.

#### Features

**Activity Log:**
- Chronological list of activities
- Activity type filtering
- Date range filtering
- Activity details

**Activity Types:**
- Order placements
- Configuration changes
- Service starts/stops
- Signal approvals/rejections
- Login/logout events

#### Actions
- **Filter Activities:** Apply filters
- **View Details:** Click activity for details
- **Export:** Export activity log (if implemented)

#### Usage Tips
- Review activity for security
- Track configuration changes
- Monitor order activity
- Use for audit purposes

---

### 14. Login (`/login`)

**Purpose:** User authentication.

#### Features
- Email/password login
- Remember me option (if implemented)
- Forgot password link (if implemented)
- Link to signup page

#### Actions
- **Login:** Authenticate and access dashboard
- **Sign Up:** Navigate to signup page

---

### 15. Signup (`/signup`)

**Purpose:** User registration.

#### Features
- Email input
- Password input (with requirements)
- Name input
- Terms acceptance (if implemented)

#### Actions
- **Sign Up:** Create new account
- **Login:** Navigate to login page

## üé® UI Features

### Navigation
- **Sidebar:** Persistent navigation sidebar
- **Breadcrumbs:** Navigation breadcrumbs (if implemented)
- **User Menu:** User profile and logout
- **Role-Based Menu:** Different menu items for admin/users

### Real-Time Updates
- **Auto-Refresh:** Configurable auto-refresh
- **WebSocket:** Real-time updates (if implemented)
- **Polling:** Regular data polling

### Data Display
- **Tables:** Sortable, filterable tables
- **Pagination:** Page-based navigation
- **Column Customization:** Show/hide columns
- **Filters:** Multiple filter options

### Responsive Design
- **Mobile Support:** Responsive layout
- **Desktop Optimized:** Full-featured desktop experience
- **Tablet Support:** Tablet-friendly layout

## üîë Keyboard Shortcuts

- `Ctrl+K` / `Cmd+K`: Quick search (if implemented)
- `Esc`: Close modals/dialogs
- `Enter`: Submit forms
- `Tab`: Navigate form fields

## üí° Best Practices

1. **Start with Paper Trading:** Test strategies before going live
2. **Monitor Regularly:** Check orders, targets, and P&L daily
3. **Review Logs:** Monitor logs for errors
4. **Configure Carefully:** Adjust trading config based on performance
5. **Use Filters:** Use filters to focus on relevant data
6. **Customize Columns:** Show only relevant information
7. **Keep Service Running:** Enable automated trading service
8. **Review Activity:** Check activity log for security
